text: is a Japanese martial art that focuses on drawing a sword (typically a katana). It is about being aware and being capable of quickly drawing the sword and responding to a sudden attack.Christensen, Karen and Allen Guttmann 2001. International Encyclopedia of Women and Sports: H-R. Macmillan Reference USA, page 553. Iaido movements are elegant movements. New learners often start using a wooden sword and then move on to an iait≈ç (A metal but fairly blunt sword). People that do Iaido may be called iaidoka. == References == Category:Japanese martial arts Category:Martial art techniques
title: Iaido
